en.taleName: [HERO] and the Dinosaurs Brush Their Teeth
en.taleText:
When the morning sun streamed into her room, [HERO] rubbed her eyes and stood in front of the mirror. She squeezed toothpaste onto her brushâ€”two strokes up, two strokes downâ€”but her mind was elsewhere.

She turned to her teddy bear.
â€œDo you think dinosaurs brushed their teeth, Teddy?â€ she asked, toothpaste foam making her voice funny.

Teddy stayed silent, as always. But [HERO] had made up her mind: today she would declare â€œDinosaur Dental Hygiene Dayâ€ in the forest.

She stuffed a few toothbrushes, tiny mint leaves, natural twig brushes, and a water bottle into her backpack.
â€œToday I wonâ€™t just tell themâ€”Iâ€™ll show them how!â€ she said, and set off.

At the clearing, Bronto, Rini, Taran, and Tur were waiting. But this morning something was different.

Nobody was smiling. Bronto kept his mouth tightly shut, Rini refused to speak, and Taran was hiding behind a tree.

[HERO] noticed immediately.
â€œWhatâ€™s wrong? Why the long facesâ€¦ and closed mouths?â€

Tur lowered his head and whispered,
â€œI thinkâ€¦ Taranâ€™s breath is a bitâ€¦ impressive.â€

Taran snapped,
â€œAlways me? Maybe Brontoâ€™s breath is worse!â€

Bronto swung his head around.
â€œI only chew moss in the morningâ€¦â€

Rini muttered quietly,
â€œSometimes I taste something bitter in my mouth.â€

[HERO] set her backpack down.
â€œOkayâ€¦ then today I have something wonderful to show you: toothbrushing!â€

ğŸ¦· Lesson 1: Why Clean Teeth?
[HERO] arranged some stones on the ground to form a model jaw.

She turned to Bronto:
â€œYour teeth are wide and flat because you eat leaves and fruit. Bits can easily get stuck between them.â€

Bronto nodded.
â€œJust yesterday a pear fragment fell out of my jawâ€¦â€

Then to Rini:
â€œYour teeth are smaller and close together. You eat seeds, flowers, and berriesâ€”sticky bits can cause cavities.â€

Rini shuddered.
â€œBut I love berries so muchâ€¦â€

Taran grumbled,
â€œMy teeth are sharp. Iâ€™m a predator. Nothing bothers me!â€

[HERO] grew serious.
â€œSharp teeth actually trap more blood and meat particlesâ€”and leftovers can make your breath stink over time.â€

Taran fell silent.

ğŸª¥ Lesson 2: Natural Brushes & Paste
[HERO] pulled out her special â€œDinosaur Dental Care Kitâ€:

For Bronto: A thick brush made of soft fresh twigs.
For Rini: A fine stick scented with lavender.
For Taran: A sturdy branch head wrapped in moss and mint leaves.
For Tur: Tiny polishing stones and water to buff his beak.
â€œToday weâ€™ll brush with these,â€ said [HERO]. â€œBut firstâ€”open wide!â€

Bronto cracked his jaw a little. Rini giggled. Taran grumbled. Tur gently raised his head.

â€œIf everyoneâ€™s readyâ€”letâ€™s begin,â€ [HERO] declared.

ğŸµ The Brushing Song
[HERO] started to sing:

Swipe right, swipe left, brush away, brush away,  
Shine your teeth both night and day, la la la!  
Big dinosaur or little girl, itâ€™s all the same,  
Clean teeth suit everyoneâ€”itâ€™s not a game!  
Bronto tapped his tail to the beat.
Rini joined in the chorus.
Taran cracked a small smile and brought the brush to his mouth for the very first time.
Tur gently polished his beak with the tiny stones.

ğŸ˜¬ Tiny Mishaps
Bronto got overexcitedâ€”
â€œBrruuushhh!â€ he roared, accidentally knocking Riniâ€™s water over with his tail.
Rini squealed, â€œMy water!â€
[HERO] laughed: â€œDonâ€™t worry, Iâ€™ve got a spare bottle!â€

Taran pressed too hard with his brush and his gums oozed a little.
â€œOuchâ€”this hurts!â€

[HERO] knelt beside him.
â€œGo slowly. Itâ€™s not about strengthâ€”itâ€™s about cleaning.â€

Taran brushed more gently.

Tur found his own method: he rubbed his beak with mud and a polishing stone, then wiped it clean with a leaf.

ğŸ‰ Dinosaur Tooth Festival
For a whole week, everyone brushed morning and night.
On Saturday, [HERO] threw a â€œDinosaur Tooth Festival.â€

Giant leaves became decorations.
Moss brushes hung like ornaments.
Each dinosaur strutted down a leafy runway to show off their clean smiles.

Prizes were awarded:

Bronto: â€œMost Gentle Brusherâ€
Rini: â€œMintiest Fresh Breathâ€
Tur: â€œCreative Cleaning Techniqueâ€
Taran: â€œCourage to Changeâ€
When Taran took the stage, he said,
â€œI used to boast only about my strong teeth. Now Iâ€™m proud to be cleanâ€”and respectful, too.â€

ğŸŒ™ That Eveningâ€¦
At home, [HERO] brushed her own teeth with extra enthusiasm.
She turned to Teddy:
â€œI think brushing teeth isnâ€™t just about hygiene anymoreâ€¦ itâ€™s a friendship ritual.â€

ğŸ““ [HERO]â€™s Dinosaur Journal
ğŸ¦• What I learned today:

Herbivores have broad, flat teeth.
Carnivoresâ€™ sharp teeth trap more debris and need extra care.
You can clean teeth naturally with:
Soft leaves, salty stones, minty mud
Brushing teeth is not just hygieneâ€”it builds selfâ€‘respect.
Dinosaurs, like us, can learn new habits with patience, play, and friendship!
